intro: Poa turgensis, commonly known as the turgent meadow grass, is a species of grass native to South America. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, erect culms. The plant produces small, spikelet-bearing inflorescences that are typically clustered at the tips of the stems. Its leaves are usually narrow and have a bluish-green coloration. Poa turgensis is often found in moist, temperate habitats such as meadows and wetlands.
